alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Oldham (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 10:27PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Oldham and north central Deaf Smith Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1027 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southeast of Adrian, or 9 miles west of Vega, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Adrian. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
